results.title: The Miraculous Mellops 2. Part 3
results.creator_credit: Posie Graeme-Evans, Millenium Pictures, Film Australia and Karl Zwicky
results.brief_description: Using the Intergalatic phone book, the Mellops use the WOOP to go to Planet Peaceful where the Grubs have caused havoc. Sam and Mike get WOOPed aboard the Grub Spaceship where they try to unsuccessfully gain access to the WOOP manual. The grubs try to eat Dump but he tastes so awful that they let him go. The return to Earth is not a pleasant experience and Dump makes it back in his underpants.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Posie Graeme-Evans, Millenium Pictures, Film Australia and Karl Zwicky

results.title: The Miraculous Mellops 2. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Posie Graeme-Evans, Millenium Pictures, Film Australia and Karl Zwicky
results.brief_description: Jason’s icypole model of the Opera House looks a little sad, so the Mellops decide to use the WOOP to get pictures of the real one. Darren however has stolen the WOOP and taken it to Dump who has now converted his compund to a travel agency. The kids try to work out plans to regain the WOOP and manage to transport Dump into the path of a runaway bull. He has to take the long way home. Meanwhile the kids are receiving more holofaxes from the Grubs.

results.title: The Miraculous Mellops 2. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Posie Graeme-Evans, Karl Zwicky, Film Australia and Millenium Pictures
results.brief_description: In this series of episodes, the Mellops family discover WOOPS or Windows of Opportunity; the only known way to travel faster than light. The alien grubs and their disgusting habits are planning to visit earth and Dump manages to steal the WOOP for his own purposes but runs into a few pointy obstacles. The adventures of the Mellops, Dumps and Grubs, takes us out of the plant nursery into outer space.

results.title: The Miracle worker
results.creator_credit: Fred Coe, Playfilm Productions and Arthur Penn
results.brief_description: Ann Bancroft and Patty Duke reprised their stage roles and won Academy Awards for their performances in “The Miracle worker.” Blind and deaf from an early childhood illness, Helen Keller lived in a world of solitude where animal instinct and a strong will enabled her to survive the dangers of everyday life. Annie Sullivan, a poor partially blind Irish girl, comes to the Keller mansion to teach Helen. She also has indomitable courage and strength but must struggle not only with Helen’s enormous will, but against a family whose love and pity for their child is so great, it keeps her locked in a prison of darkness and ignorance. A moving film with outstanding performances. Based on the play by William Gibson and the lives of two incredible women.

results.title: The Miracle of life (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Sveriges television, Bo G. Erikson and Carl O Lofman
results.brief_description: With the aid of highly magnified internal live photography, medical filmmakers, Lennart Nilsson, Bo Erikson and Carl Lofman, are able to bring to the screen the first filmed sequence of the human ovum undergoing the process of fertilisation - the exact moment when life begins. “The Miracle of Life” then follows the exciting development of the foetus as it prepares to enter the world outside.

results.title: The Miracle of Humpty Doo
results.brief_description: Describes the success of a rice-growing station in the Northern Territory. The venture, undertaken by the Australian-American Territory Rice Ltd is part of an overall plan to open up large areas of the Territory for the growing of rice, which will find a ready market in Asian countries.

results.title: The Mining town: (Casting the money-lenders from the Temple)
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, David Muir, Australian National Gallery and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 21 of Series “The Australian eye IV”.
A study of the painting “The Mining town” by Arthur Boyd. Arthur Boyd, as an artist, has developed his own personal imagery to express the universal themes of love and oppression of life and death, regeneration and metamorphosis. The film is centred around one of his most complex allegorical paintings. He speaks of the effect of his upbringing and family background upon the style and content of his work and the influence of Brueghel on his art.

results.title: The Mining and smelting of copper
results.brief_description: Copper is a conductor of electricity used for electrical wiring, prevents rust. Shows copper mining scenes in Arizona, Utah and Montana which produce three-quarters of copper mined in the USA. Also shows mining operations including smelting.
